adjective.description: Designating, of, or relating to the Nipmucs or their language.

noun.description: A member of any of several Algonquian-speaking North American Indian peoples formerly inhabiting parts of central Massachusetts and adjacent Connecticut and Rhode Island. Also, in later use: a member of any of several groups claiming decent from these.

origin: Mid 17th century; earliest use found in Roger Williams. From Massachusett and Narragansett Neepmuck, Neepnet, perhaps a place name.
